intro: Adenia gummifera, commonly known as the gum tree or white ant plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often attracting various pollinators. Its latex sap is milky and can be used in traditional medicine. Adenia gummifera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitats.
